title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the ajc command to compile files and create a .jar file using the outjar option, the resulting .jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
OB: After executing the ajc command with the sourceroots option pointing to <mydir>, and the outjar option specifying <my.jar>, an output file is created with a .jar extension.
EB: However, the created .jar file does not meet the requirements of a valid .jar file because it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file inside.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Execute the ajc command specifying the source roots as <mydir>.
2. Use the outjar option to specify the output .jar file as <my.jar>.
3. Verify that the generated .jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
